quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [screaming, Phyllis and Dwight wrestling]  Got you!  Broken arm!  Boom Boom Boom!  Broken Nose! Boom Boom Boom Boom!  Broken Nose!  Boom!  Ha, gonna flip you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Once a year Dwight holds a seminar updating us on the newest developments in the world of karate... because as we all know, the one thing thousand year martial arts do all the time is change.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How can I pose this to you in a relatable way?  You are all members of the Yakuza and you happen to be visiting the Lackawanna trolley museum... and you are attacked by triads... how can you hold them off until your clan arrives?  You cannot go wrong with a throat punch [screams, pretends to punch Meredith in the throat]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, so there's no defense for that, good to know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, there is a defense for that.  Let me demonstrate.  Someone attack me.  Kevin, go!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No way.  Last time you pulled my pants down and then you tried to choke me with my shoelace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: False.  I did choke you with your shoelace.  Now come at me!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, with all due respect to everyone here, I think the most worthy opponent of you is you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That is correct.  Unless there happened to be measles present.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So let's just say that Dwight has come at you with the throat punch.  Now how would you, Dwight, defend against it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Easy.  Allow me to demonstrate.  I am attacking myself with a throat punch.  Here it comes. [gives himself a fake throat punch]  Block.  Grasp wrist as such. [grasps wrist]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And what if he comes at you with the other hand, because he does have two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good point.  Second, throat punch, absorb the blow. [gives himself another throat punch and proceeds to both attack and defend himself]  Groin punch, hip block, elbow to the gut.  Uh oh, up to the nose.  No, you're not.  Ow!  Oh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my God, he's making you look like such a fool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He really is, but not for long.  [steps on foot]  Ow! Instep, oh, not again.  [more screaming] You let go, you let go.  Oh, you're right, I can't hold on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You two are so evenly matched I don't know how one of you is going to get the upper hand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The important thing to remember Jim... we always have what is called the element of surprise. [hits himself in the groin and moans]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But I would say my favorite art form is a tie between sculpting and stand up comedy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I did stand up comedy once.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You did?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, I killed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That sounds like it was hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It was hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What is the meaning of this email that everyone got?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You'll have to be more specific Dwight, I get like eight emails a day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This one, from David Wallace to all Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Woo hoo, shout out!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hello everyone I am sure you have seen the item in the Journal.  I just want to stress that it's all conjecture.  If there's any concrete news you will know ASAP.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Erin, do we have the journal?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Your feelings journal?  You told me to put it in the time capsule.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Did you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, he means the Wall Street Journal online.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, the Wall.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I found the article. [everyone walks over to his desk, he begins reading the article]  "On a day marked by panicked corporate board meetings, one that is relatively not surprising is Dunder Mifflin's.  It is rumored that they will recommend... " and the article cuts off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's $1.99 to finish the article.  I wonder what it was going to say? [no one makes a move to pay for the article]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you serious? [starts typing on the computer and Andy begins to lean in toward the computer]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I got it, I got it... Oh, Tuna beat me to it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: "It is rumored that they will recommend declaring bankruptcy."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, that doesn't make any sense.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh lord, we're all gonna lose our jobs.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Not necessarily, bankruptcy could mean a lot of things.  Maybe they're just restructuring to get out of debt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, that sounds awful.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Or it could mean the end of Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh God.  Well, that's an interesting theory.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what?  You can all have jobs at Schrute Farms as human scarecrows.  It doesn't pay much and you can't unionize.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace's Secretary
quotes.line: I'm sorry, Michael, David's in a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, well maybe you should spy on him.  [in Valley Girl voice] Oh my God, wouldn't that be hilarious! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace's Secretary
quotes.line: Um, I'll just have him call you back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, OK.  Good.  I'll catch you on the flippity flip.  Bye. [hangs up phone]  He's busy, he'll call me back when he's free.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [retching sounds coming from the men's bathroom, Kevin walks to the door and goes in] Michael, are you OK?  Did you throw up in there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I'm just poopin'.  You know how I be.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: It smells like throw up in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Crazy world.  Lotta smells.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [in lunch room with several coworkers]  Guys, what if this is our last day at work?  What if we never see each other ever again?  [Andy scoffs and looks over at Erin, Erin looks sad]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I like Erin. There, I said it.  I was kinda hoping she would ask me out, but things have not panned out on that front, so... it is time for the Nard Dog to take matters into his own paws.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Michael in his office playing music loudly, Jim walks in and turns the volume down, Michael trailing off on singing]  We have to do something because people are losing it out there wondering what's going to happen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, we need some sort of distraction for everybody.  Anything new on YouTube?  Doesn't even need to be good.  Oh God, I can't think, need more Mullins.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Listen, Wallace said these were just rumors, right? So we have no reason to think the company is anything but fine.  So if we just go on with our work, you and me, they'll follow along.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Monkey see, monkey do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Monkey pee all over you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That rhymes, so what have we on the docket today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We have a monthly staff meeting

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, let's conference room it up! [everyone is now in the conference room]  Here's the deal guys.  There is no new information as of yet, so I suggest we all just keep working.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure I'm a little nervous, but doing our work will make us feel better.  I only slack off when things are good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Customers have to use the coupon code from the website.  And as of now there is no differentiation between the letter O and the zero, but we are working on that. Stay tuned for that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Michael leaves] He needs me.  Seat saved infinity. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [walks back in, on cell phone] What? Oh my God!  [everyone starts asking questions]  There has been a murder.  There's been a murder in Savannah. [runs back to his office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Games have the power to distract people from stressful situations.  Battleship got me through my parents' divorce.  Operation got me through my vasectomy, i.e., my operation.  I don't think I would have been able to endure my breakup with Holly had it not been for Toss Across.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [reading the game box cover] Belles, Bourbon and Bullets, a murder mystery dinner party game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It is so much fun.  Everybody plays a character, we go around the room, we try to figure out who did it...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, I am wondering if this is a, uh, terrible idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is my call Jim, big picture stuff, it's about murder.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I thought we agreed that we wouldn't do things like this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Tube City, you owe me one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Co-managing is a give and take.  You have to pick your battles.  One of the battles that I picked was to stop Michael from running plastic tubes all over the office and placing hamsters inside of them.  He was going to call it Tube City. So, yes, I do owe him one.

quotes.speaker: Voice on CD player
quotes.line: August the 5th, 1955.  It's a sad day down here in Savannah.  Local magnate Bill Bourbon was killed last night and all y'all have congregated tonight for a meal to celebrate Bill as he passes on to his great reward.  You're not just here to pay your respects, you have to figure out which of y'all is the no-count scoundrel who killed him.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: This is ridiculous. [gets up to leave, as does Angela]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There will be food. You leave, you do not get food.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What kind of food?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sandwich platters.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm in. [sits back down]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Baby carrots. [Angela sits back down]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, here are your character cards.  Take one, pass it down. Here is your prop box, some of your characters will have props.  Now, on your character card, it tells you who you are, and what your alibi is.  Everything else is up to your imagination.  So, if you talk slowly in real life, your character could, say, have been kicked in the head by a horse.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Whoa, I'll try it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: OK, use your imaginations.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Who'd you get?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Naughty Nellie Nutmeg, a vivacious young socialite with a penchant for scandal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oooooo, saucy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: How about you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Nathaniel Nutmeg, the local bartender and Nellie's brother.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael, I don't like this game.  It's scary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's not scary.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I don't like my character.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Who are you?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Voodoo Mama Juju, the witch doctor of the Savannah swamps.  I'm not comfortable with this. [holds up a head]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well how do you think I feel?  I mean I have to play Caleb Crawdad, handsome playboy.  Every night, a different woman.  Being oogled.  Having to hug and kiss and spoon, I make them feel beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [looks at Oscar who is using his phone, grabs it] Well, well, well.  What is this contraption, I do declare?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It's my blackberry Michael, I am trying to get updates on the company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who's Michael?  I'm Caleb Crawdad, I do declare.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You don't have to keep saying "I do declare".  Any time you say something it means you are declaring.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is the way Southern people talk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And what Designing Woman are you basing that on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Delta Burke, I do declare.  Now, shall we get to the mystery?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'll go.  [stands up, begins speaking with a southern accent]   My name is Deborah U. Tante.   Deb for short.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That's clever, Debutante.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Bill Bourbon was my uncle.  I would have never hurt him any more than I'd hurt a June bug.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Nice accent.  You sound like Forrest Gump.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I do not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, you do actually.  You've got this kinda like Florida Panhandle thing going, whereas what you really want is more of a Savannah accent, which is more like molasses just sorta spillin' out of your mouth.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oooo, now do the Swedish chef.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh, not familiar, what province is he from?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: He lives on Sesame Street, dumbass.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You know, I think I'm supposed to say something to Pam, I mean, Deb, OK?  [in character] I overheard you asking the butler where the pistol was kept.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait a minute, wait a minute.  I'm the butler.  You were listening in on that?  You rich people.  You think you can do whatever you want to the servant class!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no. Don't turn this into a political thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I will poison your food.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I reckon I got something to say to Miss Beatrix Bourbon, if'n she don't mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oooooo, doggie, we got a party now!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I do believe that the game is a big hit. People are really diving into their characters.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Y'all.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [Creed pulls into the parking lot and goes into the office]  Sorry I'm late, boss.  What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [accent] Sir, there has been a murder, and you are a suspect.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: OK. Hang on just a second.  Let me just settle in and I'll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Very good, very good.  Now, no one was there in the wine cellar. [Creed gets in his car and drives away]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [in character] Hey there young lady.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I would be remiss if I did not ask the pretty young lady out on a date for this weekend.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Sounds like a plan, Sugar.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Alright, a plan it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Voodoo Mama Juju, explain your dalliance with the Dark Arts.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's not my fault, I was exposed to Harry Potter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know you did it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know she didn't do it.  It's never the person you most suspect. It's also never the person you least suspect, since anyone with half a brain would suspect them the most.  Therefore I know the killer to be Phyllis, AKA Beatrix Bourbon, the person I most medium suspect.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [in character] Do you want to go out on a date with me?  We can make out by the horses.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well, you know ol' Nellie's always up for a romp in the hay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: How about a threesome?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah, my boudoir's always open.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm a little worried I might have asked out Naughty Nellie and not Erin.  Which would be a whole lot less appealing, because Naughty Nellie says yes to everyone.  And she might be a murderer.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I just got an email from corporate, specifically for Accounting to stop all payments to our vendors.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well, maybe nothing but it could mean a problem with liquidity-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [accent] Whoa. What's this strange Yankee accent coming out of your mouth, son?  This here's Savannah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [tries to speak in a high-pitched southern accent] This plantation, we're running low on greenbacks.  We're having problems paying the people who give us the seeds and the dirt.  We can't pay... [in regular voice] - Michael, I can't - Basically it could mean a lot of things, but it is unprecedented, so it's cause for concern.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, I'm going back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No no no no no no no. [accent] I'm going to skip forward to a relevant clue.  Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Voice on CD player
quotes.line: Well by now you've figured out that ol' Beatrix Bourbon was the killer.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Michael, I was doing so well.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [accent] Are you going to believe that? That is a mis- that's a misdirection.  We still don't know who the murderer is.  [everyone leaves] Nellie Nutmeg, come back in here.  I can't do this myself.  Voodoo Mama Juju... what am I gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK, so Corporate is still in their meeting.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: That could be a good sign.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hey everyone, Kevin's going to give us his take on the situation.  Let's listen up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright guys, it's a work day and you guys work here, so let's go do some work.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Now, Jim telling us all to work?  I think that is a very good sign.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Don't just say things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Michael walks in] Oh, hey, Michael. Listen, I brought up those sales targets.  Do you want to-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [accent] I do believe you have me mistaken, my name is Caleb Crawdad. Y'all skedaddled way too soon.  We need to reopen this case.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, you're not reopening the case.  The case is closed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No it ain't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Frankly, I'm not surprised.  A lot of the evidence seemed to be based on puns.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Just thinking about Weekend at Bernie's.  It's funny, the guy's dead the whole time.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I haven't seen it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Speaking of weekends, you excited about our date this weekend?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [accent] Of course, Nathaniel.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, OK.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [accent] Where are you taking me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [accent] Well, finest steakhouse in all Savannah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [accent] Savannah?  That's a far way from Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Did you mean a real date?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: No. [laughs] Did you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Totally... not. [Erin gets up and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I thought it was for real.  So I was excited, but it was just, it was part of the game.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're sure it was water, it couldn't have been acid?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I already declared you, it was too dark to tell.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Stop playing games with me, Crawdad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is not a game, this is my life.  You are out of order, sir.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Answer me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You are out of order.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You are out of order.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You are-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think Michael may have snapped.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Or maybe he's just stuck in character.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, which is worse? Snapped or stuck?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Both.  They're both worse.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's going to be alright. We're a good company, we'll figure this out.  We're not going under.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim, what if we both lose our jobs?  I'm trying to think of a way that this all ends up fine, and I can't think of one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [comes into Jim's office using accent] Deb, what in the world - do you have the vapors?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, not now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can't wait, we have to get you to our witch doctor right now.  Come on.  Come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I should just go.  [accent]  Where to now Caleb?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: To Mama Juju Boo Boo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, can I... OK, I'm just going to skip right past the what and go with why.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because this is the recreation of a crime scene.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [laying on the ground] I'm the dead body and these are my brain chunks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey shut up.  You're dead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael, can I talk to you in your office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No Michael here, my name is-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Caleb!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Today of all days...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, you shut up.  They need this game, Jim.  Let us have this stupid little game, alright? [Jim nods]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [accent] Oh, you startled me.  My stars, my heart nearly leapt out of my chest.  What can I do you for?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Wallace is on the phone.  He's returning your call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Detective Wallace?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I don't think so.  I think it's David Wallace from Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Aw, shucks, tell him I'm not here.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You're not gonna answer the phone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I only answer to Detective Wallace 'cause I got a warm body in the other room.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'll take it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Hey, sorry to be getting back to you guys so late.  Things are still a bit unclear, we didn't officially decide anything yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, OK.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: But if I can be candid with you here Jim, it's not good.  We fully expect to be out of money by the end of the year.  Insolvent.  So, well... You know what?  I'm sorry, I have to run.  But we will talk soon, OK?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure.  Oh, you know, while I have you... today I was working on this pitch for a supermarket chain, and it would actually be a big account and I wanted to-

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: You know what? I can't really get my head around anything like that right now, but that's great.  Keep after it, but I gotta run.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Thanks Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: See ya.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Jim comes out of the office]  What's the news?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nothing yet.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Well, I guess that's not-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well there is some bad news.  [accent] There has been another murder.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A murder, you say?  I do declare.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Conference room everyone.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Do we have to play?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Super.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, this could be a juicy one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Get in there!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think today was a good day to have two managers.  'Cause if you're a family stuck on a lifeboat in the middle of the ocean, one parent might want to just keep rowing.  But if the other parent wants to play a game, it's not because they're crazy.  It's because they're doing it for the kids.  And I get that now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There has been a lot of murder and a lot of intrigue.  My little heart can barely take it no more.  [regular voice] Today is the hardest I have worked in a long, long time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Andy, Michael, and Dwight are pointing imaginary guns at each other] I didn't do it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, everybody just calm down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I am calm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: On the count of three we're all going to put down our guns.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have crossbows.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We'll put down our weaponry on the count of three, you ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK, I'm ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: One, two, three.. [all scream]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Andy revealed himself to be a double agent.  At which point Dwight felt comfortable revealing that he also was double agent.  And then Michael announced to everybody that - get this- he was a double agent.  Oh, and it is 6:00.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Michael, Dwight, Andy and now Pam are in the circle and training their 'weapons' on each other, Jim walks in]  Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [accent] It wasn't me.  I'm not goin' down for this!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, I want to go home.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Get the keys out of my purse, start the car. [Jim and Pam slowly back out of the office, Pam has her weapon trained on everyone and then they run out]
